isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT-6613 SERIES - REMOVE - AUXILIARY INTERMEDIATE HOUSING

figure.caption: Figure 58. Auxiliary Intermediate Housing Exploded View
Figure 59. Remove Bolts and Retainer Plate From Rear of Mainshaft

step1.para: Remove the intermediate drive gear from the shaft and if necessary, remove the two snap rings and plate from the inner diameter of the intermediate drive gear ( Figure 60).
Cut the lockwire and remove the lockscrew from the intermediate shift yoke ( Figure 61).

figure.caption: Figure 61. Remove Lockscrew From Intermediate Shift Yoke

step1.para: Remove the intermediate shift shaft and yoke from the housing ( Figure 62).

figure.caption: Figure 62. Remove Intermediate Shift Shaft and Yoke

step1.para: Remove the left countershaft from the housing, using caution to avoid damage to the oil trough ( Figure 63).

figure.caption: Figure 63. Remove Left Countershaft From Housing

step1.para: Remove the auxiliary drive gear and the sliding clutch assembly the splines of the mainshaft ( Figure 64). Both sections must align with the splines for removal.

figure.caption: Figure 64. Remove Auxiliary Drive Gear and Sliding Clutch Assembly

step1.para: Pull the right auxiliary countershaft from the intermediate case ( Figure 65).

figure.caption: Figure 65. Pull Right Auxiliary Countershaft From Intermediate Case

step1.para: Pull the front bearings from the countershafts if necessary ( Figure 66).

figure.caption: Figure 66. Pull Front Bearings From Countershafts

step1.para: Remove the three bolts and the oil trough from the intermediate housing ( Figure 67).

figure.caption: Figure 67. Remove Bolts and Oil Trough

step1.para: Remove the remaining bolts and the intermediate housing from the transmission ( Figure 68).

figure.caption: Figure 68. Remove Bolts and Intermediate Housing

step1.para: Remove the snap ring spacers from the front countershaft bearing bores ( Figure 69).

figure.caption: Figure 69. Remove Snap Ring Spacers From Front Countershaft Bearing Bores
